450 
WGUS83 KLBF 091530
FLSLBF
FLOOD STATEMENT 
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE NORTH PLATTE NE 
1030 AM CDT MON JUN 9 2014

...THE FLOOD WARNING CONTINUES FOR THE FOLLOWING RIVERS IN 
NEBRASKA...

SOUTH PLATTE RIVER NEAR ROSCOE AFFECTING DEUEL AND KEITH COUNTIES.
  
.THE SOUTH PLATTE RIVER NEAR ROSCOE HAS RISEN ABOVE FLOOD STAGE AND
WILL CONTINUE TO RISE THROUGH THE DAY TODAY. HEAVY RAINS IN AMOUNTS
OF 2 TO 4 INCHES FELL ACROSS THE SOUTH PLATTE RIVER BASIN SINCE
SUNDAY MORNING. RUNOFF FROM THIS RAINFALL ON TOP OF THE ALREADY HIGH
FLOWS COMING OUT OF COLORADO FROM SNOWMELT RUNOFF IN THE
MOUNTAINS...WILL CAUSE THE RIVER TO KEEP RISING. THE RIVER IS
EXPECTED TO CREST JUST BELOW 9.5 FEET THIS EVENING...THEN WILL STAY
NEARLY STEADY BEFORE FALLING BACK BELOW FLOOD STAGE BY THURSDAY.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

SAFETY MESSAGE...STAY TUNED FOR FURTHER DEVELOPMENTS BY LISTENING TO 
NOAA WEATHER RADIO...RADIO AND TELEVISION STATIONS OR ONLINE AT 
WWW.WEATHER.GOV/NORTHPLATTE.

&&

NEC049-101-101530-
/O.CON.KLBF.FL.W.0002.000000T0000Z-140613T0600Z/
/RSON1.1.RS.140609T0509Z.140610T0000Z.140612T0600Z.NO/
930 AM MDT MON JUN 9 2014

THE FLOOD WARNING CONTINUES FOR
  THE SOUTH PLATTE RIVER NEAR ROSCOE.
* UNTIL LATE THURSDAY NIGHT.
* AT  8:30 AM MONDAY THE STAGE WAS 9.2 FEET. 
* FLOOD STAGE IS 9.0 FEET. 
* MINOR FLOODING IS OCCURRING AND MINOR FLOODING IS FORECAST.
* FORECAST...THE RIVER WILL CONTINUE RISING TO NEAR 9.4 FEET THIS 
  EVENING. THE RIVER WILL FALL BELOW FLOOD STAGE EARLY THURSDAY 
  MORNING.
* IMPACT...AT 9.0 FEET...FLOOD STAGE. MINOR FLOODING OF AGRICULTURAL 
  LAND ALONG THE RIVER. 

&&

LAT...LON 4111 10170 4114 10170 4114 10135 4110 10135
